name: Baba Ganoush
description: This easy baba ganoush makes such a delicious and healthy dip or appetizer. It's great with pita, flatbread, or as a side dish to falafel and tabouleh. And the recipe couldn't be much easier!

recipeInstructions.text: With a sharp knife, cut the eggplant into half lengthwise. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the eggplant halves on top with the flesh-side facing up.
recipeInstructions.name: With a sharp knife, cut the eggplant into half lengthwise. Line a baking tray with parchment paper and place the eggplant halves on top with the flesh-side facing up.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush with olive oil (I used about one tablespoon in total).
recipeInstructions.name: Brush with olive oil (I used about one tablespoon in total).

recipeInstructions.text: Bake them for 40 minutes. Cover them with aluminium foil for the last 10-15 minutes, so they don't become too brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake them for 40 minutes. Cover them with aluminium foil for the last 10-15 minutes, so they don't become too brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the eggplants cool down for about 10 minutes, so they are easier to handle. In the meanwhile place the remaining ingredients into a food processor.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the eggplants cool down for about 10 minutes, so they are easier to handle. In the meanwhile place the remaining ingredients into a food processor.

recipeInstructions.text: Scrape out the flesh of the eggplant with a spoon and add it to the tahini mixture. Process until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Scrape out the flesh of the eggplant with a spoon and add it to the tahini mixture. Process until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley, some more olive oil, and red pepper flakes. Serve with warm pita bread. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle with freshly chopped parsley, some more olive oil, and red pepper flakes. Serve with warm pita bread. Enjoy!

keywords: baba ganoush, baba ganoush recipe, how to make baba ganoush
